question.text: The figure shows blood circulation in humans with labels a to b. Select the option which gives correct identification of label and functions of the part.

options.text: b - Capillary-Thin without muscle layer and wall two cell layers thick
c - Vein-Thin walled and blood flows in jerks/spurts
d - Pulmonary vein-Takes oxygenated blood to heart $\mathrm{pO}_2=95$ $\mathrm{mm} \mathrm{Hg}$
a - Artery-Thick walled and blood flows evenly

solution.text:
a- Artery- Carry blood from heart to body parts. It is thick walled and elastic, under high blood pressure. b- Capillary- thin walled, with only one layer, facilitates the diffusion of nutrients, gases, etc., into tissues c- Vein - thin walled, brings blood from body parts to heart, act as low resistance conduct for blood flow. d- Pulmonary vein-take oxygenated blood to heart, $p \mathrm{O}_2=95 \mathrm{~mm} \mathrm{Hg}$. (Ref. to Fig. 14.2)
Caution Pulmonary artery takes deoxygenated blood $\quad$ carries oxygenated blood from lungs to from heart to lungs, while pulmonary vein heart. $$ \text { Related Theory } $$ (Ref. to Fig. 14.3)
